questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting an issue with Cisco Jabber for Windows clients. Users report that they receive the error message “cannot find your services automatically.” All users on the corporate network with an on-premises Cisco IM and Presence server report this issue. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.B: Add _collab-edge SRV records to the external DNS server.
choices.C: Add _cisco-uds and _cuplogin A records to the internal DNS server.
choices.A: Set the AUTHENTICATOR CLI argument for the Jabber clients.
choices.D: Add _cisco-uds and _cuplogin SRV records to the internal DNS server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
unless the customer has pre 9.6 Jabber Clients the cuplogin record is not needed
D should still be the correct answer

choices.C: Disable “Force All MWIs Off for This Phone System” under Telephony Integrations > Phone System > Phone System Basics.
choices.D: Check and reseat the RS-232 serial cable connection on the master PIMG/TIMG.
choices.A: Select the “Use Same Port for Enabling and Disabling MWIs” check box under Telephony Integrations > Phone System,
choices.B: Enable “Message Count Totals” for cluster B users Playback Message Settings.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Kinda misleading again:

"MWIs Do Not Turn On or Off
[...]
8. Confirm that MWIs for the phone system are not forced off. To view the Force All MWIs Off for This Phone System check box, in Cisco Unity Connection Administration, select Telephony Integrations > Phone System > Phone System Basics.
[...]
13. (PIMG/TIMG serial integrations only) Confirm that the RS-232 serial cable is firmly seated in the serial port of the master PIMG/TIMG unit and in the serial port of the phone system."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/15/troubleshooting/guide/b_15cuctsg/b_15cuctsg_chapter_01110.html#ID-2410-0000002b

questions.question_text: Cisco Unity Connection system is integrated with two Cisco UCM clusters, cluster A and cluster B. Voicemail is working perfectly for users on cluster A. Users on cluster B report Message Waiting Indicator (MWI) lights are not working at all, however they can still send/receive messages. Which action resolves the issue?

An administrator is implementing a Cisco Unity Connection call management plan for a company and configured the transfer rules that specify how Unity Connection transfers the calls that reach the call handler from the automated attendant. Which call handler setting must be configured to specify whether callers can perform transfers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"The caller input settings define actions that Unity Connection takes in response to phone keys pressed by callers during a call handler greeting."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/15/design/b_15cucsag/b_12xcucsag_chapter_0111.html#ID-2420-00000106

choices.C: Port monitor option in Real Time Monitoring Tool

questions.question_text: An engineer is troubleshooting an issue with Cisco Unity Connection. Users report that they receive a busy tone when they attempt to dial the voicemail pilot number. Which tool must the engineer use to view the activity on the voicemail ports as users try to place calls?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"The RTMT Port Monitor lets you monitor the activity of each Cisco Unity Connection voice messaging port in real time."
https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-knowledge-base/using-rtmt-to-monitor-cisco-unity-connection-and-cucm/ta-p/3122211

choices.A: create a CTI route point template that will be used by Cisco UACA
choices.B: create a new end user account to be used by Cisco UACA
choices.D: create a SIP trunk between Cisco UACA and Cisco UCM
choices.C: create a CTI port template that will be used by Cisco UACA

questions.question_text: What is a step when integrating Cisco UACA with Cisco UCM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Creating a Unique Reference CTI Port Device"
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucmac/cuaca/14_0_2/admin_guide/CUACA_AG_1402201.pdf

Answer should be C:

It says specifically not to use a Route Point as a template device. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucmac/cuaca/11_0_1/install_admin_guide/CUACA110107WAG.pdf
